channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Corner of Finchley / Frognal Lane, 9th October
item.description:
The broken pedestrian gate has NOT been “fixed”; there have merely been orange cones put up. This is not a long term solution. Reference: 8228255
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1;3, Frognal Lane, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattresses and other miscellaneous waste being disposed of near residential properties, 9th October
item.description:
I live on Bush Road (SE8 5AP). At the yard behind our homes (rear of Bush Road, near Lower Road/Lidl), clearance works have begun ahead of construction. While this is happening, new piles of mixed waste are appearing that do not match the on-site demolition arisings. It looks like third-party fly-tipping may be occurring during or around the clearance activity. Could you please check whether there is an approved Construction/Logistics/Management Plan for this site and whether conditions on waste handling and site security are being followed? If helpful, I can provide dates, photos, and any vehicle details I’ve recorded.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree blown over, 9th October
item.description:
This tree blew over in the high winds at the beginning of the week (6/10/2025)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Goldsmith Road, Friern Barnet, London

item.title: Planters not filled, 9th October
item.description:
On lordship park several plant boxes were built in order to improve traffic safety, these were supposed to be filled with plants but this has not been done they are full of weeds. Also there is a lot of cycling on the pavement on the road - dangerous
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lordship Park, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped, 9th October

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bryanston Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flags on horse roundabout, 9th October
item.description:
The flags are all the way round and this is blocking the view of on coming traffic. I have witnessed near misses of accidents. It is also antisocial behaviour as it has caused an increase of racism on social media in local Bexley groups. The people putting the flags up have arranged meet ups, these people have a criminal record and have posted stuff on Facebook to rally people. This is not in the spirit of being patriotic. It is causing a divide in the community.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picardy Manorway, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flat is being occupied as an HMO without having an HMO licence, 9th October
item.description:
We believe the property at 45 Hassett Road, London E9 5SH is being occupied by 5 or more unconnected individuals, despite the property not having the benefit of an HMO licence. We are unclear how long the current occupants have been in occupation for.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hassett Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement & carriageway ready to collapse, 9th October
item.description:
Resident reporting there is a large subsidence on the pavement & carriageway that was reported by a Cllr 3 weeks ago, since the temporary barriers have been placed around the hole however now this is all ready to further collapse collapse. This is affecting the residents driveway access. Please could someone look into this as a matter of urgency. As Pedestrians & vehicles & residents are at a big risk of severe damage to them. It is a big concern to them for safety.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hillingdon Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
